questions.title: AWS_SAA_EC2_001
questions.question: You need to launch EC2 instances that can be stopped and restarted without losing data. The instances will run batch processing jobs. Which EC2 instance purchasing option is MOST cost-effective?
questions.explanation: Spot Instances offer up to 90% discount and are ideal for fault-tolerant, flexible batch jobs that can be interrupted.

questions.title: AWS_SAA_S3_001
questions.question: Which S3 storage class is MOST cost-effective for data that is accessed less than once a year but must be retrieved within milliseconds when needed?
questions.explanation: S3 Glacier Instant Retrieval provides millisecond access for rarely accessed data at lower cost than S3 Standard.

questions.title: AWS_SAA_VPC_001
questions.question: You need to allow EC2 instances in a private subnet to access the internet for software updates, but prevent inbound internet access. What should you implement?
questions.explanation: NAT Gateway allows outbound internet access from private subnets while blocking inbound connections.

questions.title: AWS_SAA_RDS_001
questions.question: Which RDS features provide high availability? (Choose TWO)
questions.explanation: Multi-AZ provides synchronous replication for HA. Read Replicas provide async replication and can be promoted for DR.

questions.title: AWS_SAA_ELB_001
questions.question: Your application requires routing based on HTTP headers and path patterns. Which load balancer should you use?
questions.explanation: ALB supports advanced routing based on HTTP headers, methods, query strings, and path patterns.

questions.title: AWS_SAA_SECURITY_001
questions.question: You need to give an EC2 instance permissions to access S3 buckets. What is the MOST secure approach?

answers.text: Embed AWS credentials in application code
Store credentials in EC2 user data
Attach an IAM role to the EC2 instance
Use AWS access keys in environment variables

questions.explanation: IAM roles provide temporary credentials automatically rotated by AWS, eliminating the need to manage long-term credentials.

questions.title: AWS_SAA_LAMBDA_001
questions.question: Your Lambda function execution time varies from 100ms to 5 minutes. How should you optimize costs?

answers.text: Set appropriate timeout and memory based on profiling

questions.explanation: Right-sizing memory and timeout based on actual usage optimizes cost. Lambda bills per GB-second.

questions.title: AWS_SAA_CLOUDFRONT_001
questions.question: You want to distribute content globally with low latency. Which AWS services work together? (Choose TWO)
questions.explanation: CloudFront is a CDN that caches content from origins like S3, reducing latency for global users.

questions.title: AWS_SAA_DDB_001
questions.question: You need a NoSQL database that automatically scales and provides single-digit millisecond latency. Which service should you use?
questions.explanation: DynamoDB is a fully managed NoSQL database with automatic scaling and consistent single-digit millisecond latency.

questions.title: AWS_SAA_MONITORING_001
questions.question: Which AWS service should you use to collect and track metrics, collect log files, and set alarms?
questions.explanation: CloudWatch is the primary monitoring service for AWS resources, providing metrics, logs, and alarms.
